intro: Agalmyla pseudoborneensis, commonly known as the Bornean agalmyla, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers with five petals. It typically grows as an understory shrub, adapting to the humid and shaded conditions of its natural habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
